DOC.HEAD: Four Blacks Killed in Township Violence
DOC.TEXT: Police said Sunday that four blacks were killed in recent violence in the townships outside Durban, where more than 160 died in December in black-on-black factional fighting. Two blacks were killed during a ``police action'' in Inanda, where a group of men were setting homes on fire, the police unrest report for the previous 24 hours said. A man was killed in a separate incident in Inanda when four huts were set on fire, the report added. In nearby KwaMashu, police found the body of a man who had been stabbed to death. Two unconscious men alongside him also had suffered multiple stab wounds. The United Democratic Front, a nationwide anti-apartheid coalition, and Inkatha, a relatively conservative Zulu group, have been battling since 1987 for political supremacy in the southeastern province of Natal. An estimated 2,500 blacks have died, and December was the most violent month yet in the townships surrounding the port city of Durban, the most populous city in the province.
